title: Former Price Comparisons
summary: Price comparisons to a "former price" must be based on actual prices at which the item was offered in good faith for a reasonably substantial period.

remediation.guidance: Only show "was $X" prices that reflect genuine prior pricing. Maintain records of historical pricing.

title: Comparable Value Claims
summary: Retail value or comparable value claims must accurately reflect the price at which comparable products are sold by others.

remediation.guidance: Verify comparable prices before using "Retail Value" or "Compare at" claims. Document competitive pricing.

title: Manufacturer List Price Claims
summary: Claims of savings from manufacturer's list price or suggested retail price must reflect prices at which products are actually sold.

remediation.guidance: Only reference MSRP if products are actually sold at that price in the market.

title: Bargain Offers Based on Other Purchases
summary: Offers like "Buy one, get one free" must not inflate the price of the first item to recover the cost of the "free" item.

remediation.guidance: In BOGO offers, the first item price must be the regular price. Do not inflate to cover free item.

title: No Bait Advertising
summary: Bait advertising is an alluring but insincere offer to sell a product which the advertiser does not intend to sell.

remediation.guidance: Ensure advertised products are available in reasonable quantities. Do not use low prices just to lure customers.

title: No Bait and Switch
summary: It is deceptive to disparage the advertised product, fail to show it, or refuse to take orders for it in order to switch consumers to a higher-priced item.

remediation.guidance: Honor advertised prices. Do not discourage purchase of advertised items to upsell alternatives.

title: Must Have Adequate Supply
summary: Advertisers must have adequate supply of advertised products to meet reasonably anticipated demand.

remediation.guidance: Stock sufficient inventory for advertised offers. If limited, clearly disclose quantity available.

title: No Refusal to Sell Advertised Item
summary: Refusal to show, demonstrate, or sell the advertised product is evidence of bait advertising.

remediation.guidance: Train staff to actively sell advertised products. Do not create obstacles to purchasing advertised items.

title: "Free" Offer Conditions Must Be Disclosed
summary: All conditions and obligations for receiving a "free" item must be clearly and conspicuously disclosed.

remediation.guidance: Disclose all conditions upfront: "Free with $50 purchase" not hidden in fine print.

title: No Continuous "Free" Offers
summary: "Free" offers cannot be used continuously - they must be intermittent to preserve the meaning of "free."

remediation.guidance: Limit duration of free offers. A perpetual "free gift" promotion is deceptive.

title: "Free" Must Be Genuinely Free
summary: The word "Free" may only be used when the consumer pays nothing for the item and is not required to purchase anything else at an inflated price.

remediation.guidance: Only use "FREE" when the item is truly free with no hidden costs or inflated companion purchase requirements.

title: "Free" Cannot Inflate Regular Price
summary: The regular price of merchandise sold with a "free" offer must not be increased to cover the cost of the free item.

remediation.guidance: Maintain regular pricing during free promotions. Do not mark up base product to cover "free" item costs.

title: "Free" Item Shipping Charges
summary: Shipping and handling charges for a "free" item must be reasonable and disclosed. Excessive S&H that covers item cost is deceptive.

remediation.guidance: If charging S&H for "free" items, charges must be reasonable and clearly disclosed before checkout.

title: Green Guides Purpose
summary: The Green Guides help marketers avoid making environmental claims that are unfair or deceptive under Section 5 of the FTC Act.

remediation.guidance: Environmental marketing claims must be truthful, substantiated, and not misleading.

title: Non-Toxic Claims
summary: Non-toxic claims must be substantiated for all foreseeable human and environmental exposures.

remediation.guidance: Substantiate non-toxic claims with testing. Consider all exposure routes and populations.

title: Recyclable Claims
summary: Recyclable claims should be qualified if recycling facilities are not available to a substantial majority of consumers.

remediation.guidance: Qualify recyclable claims: "Recyclable where facilities exist" or "Check local recycling." Specify which components.

title: Recycled Content Claims
summary: Recycled content claims must specify whether content is pre-consumer or post-consumer recycled material.

remediation.guidance: Distinguish between pre-consumer and post-consumer recycled content. Specify percentage accurately.

title: Renewable Energy Claims
summary: Renewable energy claims must be substantiated. If using RECs, marketers should not overstate environmental benefits.

remediation.guidance: Distinguish between on-site generation and REC purchases. Disclose methodology.

title: Renewable Materials Claims
summary: Renewable materials claims should not be deceptive about the overall environmental benefit.

remediation.guidance: Specify what percentage of materials are from renewable sources. Identify the renewable materials.

title: Environmental Claims Must Be Substantiated
summary: All environmental claims must be substantiated by competent and reliable scientific evidence.

remediation.guidance: Maintain documentation supporting all environmental claims. Claims should be specific and verifiable.

title: Qualify Broad Environmental Claims
summary: Broad environmental claims should be qualified to prevent deception about the product's environmental attributes.

remediation.guidance: Avoid vague claims like "eco-friendly". Use specific claims like "Made with 50% recycled plastic."

title: General Environmental Benefit Claims
summary: Unqualified general environmental benefit claims (e.g., "green" or "eco-friendly") are difficult to substantiate and should be avoided.

remediation.guidance: Replace vague environmental claims with specific, measurable benefits that can be documented.

title: Carbon Offset Claims
summary: Carbon offset claims must reflect genuine, verifiable, permanent emission reductions and should be properly qualified.

remediation.guidance: Use third-party verified carbon offsets. Disclose offset methodology and certifying body.

title: Environmental Certifications and Seals
summary: Environmental certifications and seals can be deceptive if they imply general environmental benefit without qualification.

remediation.guidance: Clarify what specific attribute the certification covers. Disclose certifying organization.

title: Compostable Claims
summary: Compostable claims should specify whether the item is suitable for home composting or requires industrial facilities.

remediation.guidance: Specify composting conditions: "Commercially compostable only" or "Home compostable." Include timeframe if relevant.

title: Degradable and Biodegradable Claims
summary: Degradable claims require evidence that the product will completely break down within one year under normal disposal conditions.

remediation.guidance: Only claim biodegradable if product fully decomposes within 1 year. Qualify for specific disposal conditions.

title: Free-Of Environmental Claims
summary: Free-of claims must be truthful and should not be made if the substance was never present or associated with the product category.

remediation.guidance: Only claim "free of X" if (1) X is typically present in similar products, and (2) absence provides environmental benefit.

title: Superlative Claims Without Basis
summary: Claims like "best", "#1", "leading", or "top-rated" require substantiation through comparative testing or market data.

remediation.guidance: Remove unsubstantiated superlative claims or provide evidence (market share data, comparative tests, awards).

title: "Clinically Proven" Without Clinical Trials
summary: Claims like "clinically proven" or "clinically tested" require actual clinical trials supporting the specific claim.

remediation.guidance: Remove "clinically proven" unless backed by published, peer-reviewed clinical trials. Cite specific studies.

title: "Doctor Recommended" Without Substantiation
summary: Claims like "doctor recommended" or "#1 doctor choice" must be based on actual surveys or endorsements from qualified medical professionals.

remediation.guidance: Remove doctor recommendation claims or provide substantiation (survey methodology, sample size, date).

title: "100% Guaranteed" Claims
summary: Absolute guarantee claims must be honored and any conditions must be clearly disclosed.

remediation.guidance: Clearly disclose all conditions, limitations, and procedures for any guarantee. Honor all guarantees offered.

title: Unsubstantiated Health Benefit Claims
summary: Health benefit claims (cures, treats, prevents disease) require competent and reliable scientific evidence.

remediation.guidance: Remove unsupported health claims. Use qualified language like "may support" with appropriate disclaimers.

title: Specific Percentage Efficacy Claims
summary: Specific percentage claims (e.g., "90% effective", "reduces wrinkles by 50%") require supporting evidence.

remediation.guidance: Substantiate percentage claims with studies or testing. Include methodology and conditions.

title: "Scientifically Proven" Without Studies
summary: Claims invoking scientific authority must be supported by actual scientific studies relevant to the claim.

remediation.guidance: Remove scientific proof claims or cite specific peer-reviewed studies with links to publications.

title: Unsubstantiated Weight Loss Claims
summary: Claims like "Lose X pounds in Y days" require competent and reliable scientific evidence. Most rapid weight loss claims are deceptive.

remediation.guidance: Remove specific weight loss claims unless supported by clinical trials. Add disclaimer about typical results and need for diet/exercise.

title: Hidden Conditions for "Free" Products
summary: Offers of "free" products with hidden conditions (shipping, subscription, purchase requirement) must clearly disclose all terms.

remediation.guidance: Disclose all conditions for "free" offers prominently and before checkout. E.g., "Free with $50 purchase" not just "FREE".

title: Free Trial Auto-Charge Without Disclosure
summary: Free trials that automatically convert to paid subscriptions must clearly disclose the conversion terms before enrollment.

remediation.guidance: Clearly disclose before checkout: (1) Free trial length, (2) Post-trial price, (3) How to cancel. Get affirmative consent.

title: Carbon Neutral Without Certification
summary: Carbon neutral and carbon offset claims should be substantiated with reliable third-party certification.

remediation.guidance: Provide certification details for carbon neutral claims. Disclose offset methodology and certifier.

title: Misleading Biodegradable Claims
summary: "Biodegradable" claims require evidence that the product completely breaks down within one year under normal disposal conditions.

remediation.guidance: Substantiate biodegradable claims with testing. Specify timeframe and disposal conditions.

title: Unsubstantiated Eco-Friendly Claims
summary: Broad environmental claims like "eco-friendly" or "green" must be qualified and substantiated.

remediation.guidance: Replace vague "eco-friendly" with specific, substantiated claims (e.g., "Made with 50% recycled content").

title: Misleading Natural or Organic Claims
summary: "Natural" and "organic" claims should be specific and substantiated. For food/cosmetics, USDA standards may apply.

remediation.guidance: Specify what makes the product natural. For organic claims, obtain USDA certification if applicable.

title: Unqualified Recyclable Claims
summary: "Recyclable" claims must specify what parts are recyclable and whether recycling facilities are available to consumers.

remediation.guidance: Qualify recyclable claims: specify which parts, include recycling instructions, note facility availability.

title: Vague Sustainable Claims
summary: Broad claims like "sustainable" should be qualified with specific, substantiated environmental benefits.

remediation.guidance: Replace vague sustainability claims with specific achievements (e.g., "Made with 100% renewable energy").

title: "Assembled in USA" Misuse
summary: "Assembled in USA" requires principal assembly in the US. Must not imply higher US content than exists.

remediation.guidance: Only use "Assembled in USA" if significant assembly occurs in the US. Disclose foreign components.

source.citation: FTC Act §5 / Made in USA Policy

title: Country of Origin Misrepresentation
summary: Misrepresenting country of origin through flags, symbols, or misleading statements is deceptive.

remediation.guidance: Accurately represent country of origin. Do not use US flags/symbols for foreign-made products.

title: Unqualified "Made in USA" Claim
summary: Unqualified "Made in USA" claims require that the product be "all or virtually all" made in the United States.

remediation.guidance: Verify that final assembly and all significant parts/processing are in the USA. If not, qualify the claim.

source.citation: FTC Act §5 / Made in USA Policy

title: No Bait and Switch
summary: Advertising an offer that is not genuinely available to lure customers is illegal.

remediation.guidance: Ensure advertised products/prices are actually available to consumers.

title: Hidden Fee Disclosure
summary: All material fees must be clearly disclosed upfront, not hidden.

remediation.guidance: Disclose all fees prominently before purchase. No surprise charges.

title: Truth in Advertising
summary: Advertising must be truthful, not misleading, and backed by evidence.

remediation.guidance: Substantiate all advertising claims before making them.
